LANDING.DESCRIPTION: Hi, I’m Giuseppe Cino and I am creative frontend developer based in Saarlouis, Germany. I enjoy bring ideas into real life.

ABOUT.DESCRIPTION_I: I am a frontend web developer with a passion for creating beautiful and functional web applications. I have a strong foundation in web development and programming, and I am always eager to learn new technologies and frameworks. I am a quick learner and a team player, and I am always looking for opportunities to grow and improve my skills.
ABOUT.DESCRIPTION_II: I am currently seeking a position as a web developer where I can contribute my skills and knowledge to create innovative and high-quality web applications.
ABOUT.TITLE: bout Me

SKILLS.TITLE: kills
SKILLS.TITLE_DESCRIPTION: I have a solid foundation in various programming languages and technologies. My strengths are particularly in frontend development, where I have gained experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Additionally, I have familiarized myself with frameworks such as Angular to create dynamic and responsive web applications. Problem-solving and creative thinking are also among my competencies, which I apply in every project to develop effective solutions.

CRM.DESCRIPTION: A very simple Customer Relationship Management system that works with CRUD functionality.
CRM.TITLE: CRM

JOIN.DESCRIPTION: Task manager inspired by the Kanban system. Create and organize tasks using drag-and-drop features, assign users and categories.
JOIN.TITLE: Join

POKEDEX.DESCRIPTION: A simple library based on the Poké API that provides and catalogs Pokemon information.
POKEDEX.TITLE: Pokedex

POLLO.DESCRIPTION: Jumping, running, and throwing game based on an object-oriented approach. Help Pepe find coins and Tabasco salsa to fight against the crazy chicken.
POLLO.TITLE: El Pollo Loco

PROJECTS.TITLE: rojects
PROJECTS.TITLE_DESCRIPTION: Here are a few projects I've worked on recently. Feel free to try them out. They represent my journey in learning and applying new skills in real-world scenarios. I'm eager to continue growing and appreciate any feedback you might have.
